intro: Noccaea corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in alpine or subalpine environments. Its life cycle is adapted to cold climates, with flowering occurring in late spring to early summer. Noccaea corymbosa is often found in high-altitude meadows and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in its native habitat.
